pull.title: Polish wordlist for BIP0039
pull.body: This is my proposition for a Polish word list.

events.body:
Recently I also came up with the description how I did it:
https://github.com/p2w34/blog/blob/master/2019-03-25-polish-word-list-bip0039/polish-word-list-bip0039.md

... BIP39 added wordlists are always ignored by all authors.

Can the authors come together on an auto-NACK agreement or something?

Ignoring them forever does not help anyone.

If you want I can maintain a separate wordlist repository similar to how SLIP-44 contains the BIP44 coin indices...

People who are born in countries that learn English at a young age do not understand how hard English is to non-european countries.

So many Japanese people gave up on holding their own keys because they can't transcribe English from a screen without writing a word wrong... But Copay supports Japanese wordlist and I have never heard a problem from anyone about it.

Refusing to support multiple languages is losing peoples' money.

issue.title: Czech wordlist for BIP0039
issue.body: Consensus set of words after discussion in czech comunity in facebook group

issue.title: Binary Lists
issue.body:
- [ ] 256/512 PGP https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PGP_word_list
- [ ] 2048 (BIP39) https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0039/bip-0039-wordlists.md
    - [ ] English https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0039/english.txt
    - [ ] Japanese https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0039/japanese.txt
    - [ ] Korean https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0039/korean.txt
    - [ ] Spanish https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0039/spanish.txt
    - [ ] Chinese https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0039/chinese_traditional.txt
    - [ ] French https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0039/french.txt
    - [ ] Italian https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0039/italian.txt
    - [ ] Russian https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/432 https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/705
    - [ ] German https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/721
    - [ ] Ukrainian https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/442
    - [ ] Czech https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/493
    - [ ] Portuguese https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/720
    - [ ] Indonesian https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/621
    - [ ] RFC-2289 https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2289
- [ ] 4096 http://www.webplaces.org/passwords/lists/hexadecimal-4096-list.txt
- [ ] 4096 https://github.com/atoponce/passplum/blob/master/packages/web/example-seed-data.json
- [ ] 4096 http://web.archive.org/web/20041016143129/http://www.tecapro.com:80/free/makepass.lst
- [ ] 4096 https://fossies.org/linux/passwdqc/wordset_4k.c
- [ ] 8192 https://github.com/ulif/diceware/blob/master/diceware/wordlists/wordlist_en_securedrop.asc
- [ ] 65536 http://www.webplaces.org/passwords/lists/hexadecimal-65536-list.txt

events.body:
There is not much going on here - I've created this PR some time ago and I've been thinking about the problem of creating all the lists ever since. I think I might have come up with a good idea of how to do this, that is why I bootstrapped it in a separate repo: https://github.com/p2w34/wlips.
Yes, that means there will be a lot of work, including re-doing existing lists. Even the Polish one I have created myslelf. I spent a lot of time thinking about it and I do not really see another approach other than trying to kinda create all of the lists at once. That is why I would like to give it a go.
Could always add a new BIP for new wordlists (or perhaps a BIP for the separate WL repo?)
I mean you could write a new BIP defining new word lists. Or even a new BIP defining an external repository for word lists.

The following words are already part of the Czech wordlist and must be replaced:

```
alkohol
ananas
astma

```

> The following words are already part of the Czech wordlist and must be replaced:
> 
> ```
> alkohol
> bananas
> ...
> ...
> ...
> zima
> znak
> ```

@tevador - I suppose your comment is based on the belief that there should be no common words among the lists. I think this is not really possible and I think quite the opposite. IMHO the lists should have as much in common as possible. Having this as the base idea I bootstrapped the repo mentioned already above (https://github.com/p2w34/wlips) and I encourage to contribute. Especially that the state of BIP0039 as it is written in the summary is: "Comments-Summary: Unanimously Discourage for implementation".

>I bootstrapped the repo mentioned already above (https://github.com/p2w34/wlips) 

I suggest a BIP (or modification to BIP 39) linking this.

> Especially that the state of BIP0039 as it is written in the summary is: "Comments-Summary: Unanimously Discourage for implementation".

You know you can always leave a comment of your own encouraging it, right?

@p2w34 It's not an explicitly stated rule, but most of the latin-alphabet wordlists follow it, e.g.

Spanish
> There are no words in common between the Spanish wordlist and any other language wordlist, therefore it is possible to detect the language with just one word.

Italian
> No words already used in other language mnemonic sets.

Czech
> No words already used in other language mnemonic sets

@tevador  - I am aware of that nevertheless thank you for additional explanation.
@luke-jr - I was postponing linking https://github.com/p2w34/wlips, but I decided not to wait and I just created a PR. Thank you.

issue.title: Adding Polish wordlist to BIP39
issue.body:
Words chosen using the following rules:

1. Words are 4-8 letters long.
2. Words can be uniquely determined typing the first 4 letters.
3. Special Polish characters like '', '', '', etc... are considered equal to 'a', 'e', 'c', etc... in terms of identifying a word. Therefore, there is no need to use a Polish keyboard to introduce the passphrase, an application with the Polish wordlist will be able to identify the words after the first 4 chars have been typed even if the chars with accents have been replaced with the equivalent without accents.
4. All words are in basic form.
5. No personal names or geographical names.
6. No very similar words with 2 letter of difference.
7. Words are sorted according English alphabet ignoring diacritic signs.
8. No words already used in other language mnemonic sets (english, italian, french, spanish, czech).
9. Built with the most popular Polish words based on the [Open frequency dictionary of lexems](https://web.archive.org/web/20091116122442/http://www.open-dictionaries.com/slownikfrleks.pdf)
10. Words include negative and bad things as those are easier to remember.

Unlike #753 it this wordlist is based on popular words dictionary and does not include any words used in other language mnemonic sets. It differs also by using polish symbols. Please consider merging it.

events.body: For now, [the author(s) of BIP 39 have decided not to accept any further word lists into BIP 39 itself, and encourage adding new ones to the WLIPs repo](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/1129#issuecomment-873258377) here: https://github.com/p2w34/wlips
